title: Typographic book recommendations
content:
**Hello** ,  
long time no see.

I am assembling a list of currently released books on typography. It is meant to be a shopping list as I intend to review them for a magazine on a quarterly basis.

Typography is meant in a rather broad term here, it could be the basics (as [Inside paragraphs](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/insideparagraphs.com/) by Cyrus Highsmith) or slightly more advanced ( [Size-specific Adjustments to Type Designs: An Investigation of the Principles Guiding the Design of Optical Sizes](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/markbattypublisher.com/books/typography-monographs-volume-2-size-specific-adjustments-to-type-designs-an-investigation-of-the-principles-guiding-the-design-of-optical-sizes/) by Tim Ahrens) or biographies (Patricia Costs book about the [Bentons](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/ritpress.rit.edu/publications/books/bentons.html) springs to mind, or the books about Excoffon and José Mendoza y Almeida from [Ypsilon éditeur](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/www.ypsilonediteur.com/typo.php)).  
Also Stephen Coles [The Anatomy(/geometry) of Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/typeanatomy.com/) obviously, and maybe I can squeeze in the second edition of Fred Smeijers [Counterpunch](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820033650/http:/www.hyphenpress.co.uk/books/978-0-907259-42-8) ?

I would like to ask you for more suggestions. It needs to be at least partly in English and preferably released in the last two or three years. Anything you consider should be in the home of a proper typographer.

ok, a happy Walpurgis Night to you all.

ƒ.
author: fredo

comments.content:
Don’t forget my _Modern Suite_ specimen.  
A bit older (2005), but it’s a real book with 160 pages and an ISBN number.
_Adrian Frutiger Typefaces_ is 5 years old--does that qualify?

By Jan Middendorp:  
_Creative Characters: The MyFonts Interviews, Vol. 1  
Type Navigator: The Independent Foundries Handbook  
Made with FontFont: Type for Independent Minds  
Shaping Text: Type, Typography and the Reader_

Yeah, som pretty good suggestions. Some of the older ones could still be interesting, for other reasons.

Thanks and keep'em coming.
